SENT.plain: Pseudotumor cerebri is a central nervous disorder with elevated intracranial pressure that is most common among young obese women
It presents with headache, transient visual obscurations and loss of central vision
Papilledema and visual field defects are frequent
Acetazolamid can be used for treatment
If medical treatment is not successful, optic nerve sheath decompression is recommended
Three patients were treated medically and there were treated surgically
Both methods stabilized or improved visual fields and central vision
